text:
Hai
 <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>
 Using the above link Iam try to submit form . But couldnot create new records. update the existing contacts with new email. How this issue solve ? Please help me to solve this issue

 Note : Iam passing "hutk":
Thank you <@UQERM7BLY> this is want I've been looking for!

Our team is trying to reverse proxy a blog from HS to be on our domain. We're CMS Enterprise, but there seems to be uncertainty if the reverse proxy works for blog pages or just web pages. Anyone know?
Can you explain your issue a bit more? It is creating new contacts or it is updating contacts. What are you expecting this to do, and what is actually happening?
this should work, this is more about a subdomain vs a page type
What does that last part mean?
A page type in HubSpot, blog, landing page, website page has no effect in what you are trying to do with a reverse proxy.
reverse proxy has more to do with dns and forwarding stuff then how pages are defined inside HubSpot. Does that make more sense?
I think so, but I know our team was having issues when doing reverse proxy for another other page types besides webpage. Any idea why that would be?

TBH, anything that has do do with this is hidden behind the HubSpot Tech Consultant services.

If you have it working for website pages, I would imagine it wouldn’t be that much more difficult to pop in a different dns address or anything like that.

I have not completed this for any client, but I understand the process and what the moving parts are, and there should be no difference between blogs and website pages because all of this is just targeting domains in reality. I wish I could help you more, but I see no reason why this wouldn’t work
Yeh, the support is pretty unhelpful when it comes to this. This functionality was the only reason we moved to CMS enterprise

YEah, I hate to say it but this stuff is really locked behind that techincal consultation and that costs quite a bit of money. There just isn’t enough documentation or other people talkign about how this was done with the details. really it is some magic that is happening and we should have better content around it
There’s some documentation on this at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/reverse-proxy-support>
I assumed they had that much, thanks Jeff for pointing that out
Hey everyone! Whats the best way to normalize all the data in a specific property using HubSpot. Ideal solution would be to have a workflow setup so that it will be enforced now and in the future.

Hello everyone !
I am using HubSpot CRM database for business, but our data are so dirty, so messy, then I had to clean my database , I downloaded my database from HubSpot CRM with no problem , But problem is cleaned database takes too much time to import to HubSpot CRM , otherwise I am trying avoid of business malfunction , but I have to clean my database immediately and import back BUT data import is taking too much time, So what kind of data edits should I use to perform with HubSpot in real time?
